Ella se dedica al comercio de productos de belleza tales como: variedad de lociones, cremas, champo, maquillaje, y de mas artículos que son atractivos para los clientes. Es una mujer muy emprendedora la cual trabaja duramente para colaborar con los ingresos del hogar y poder llevar un poco de dinero que le permita suplir algunas necesidades. Posee un puesto en el mercado Municipal de la zona donde ella habita el cual es  muy transitado. Ha luchado mucho para poder mantener a flote su negocio ya que la competencia siempre está presente y es lo que la hace mantenerse siempre atenta por mejorar. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, por lo que ya cuenta con muchos clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más  ya que es una mujer muy positiva y honrada en su trabajo. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este credito a INTEGRAL por que quiere invertir en su negocio en la compra de nueva mercadería (lociones, cremas, champo, maquillaje, etc.) que le permita mantener su negocio surtido y estar al día de los nuevos productos que van saliendo en el mercado. Para que de esta forma pueda seguir llamando la atención de una gran variedad de clientes que le permitan mejorar sus ganancias y que le den la oportunidad de ingresar a una mejor calidad de vida. Ella expresa estar muy agradecida con esta institución ya que en el pasado le brindaron ayuda cuando más lo necesitaba, fue así como su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco. Espera poder obtener  resultados favorables en esta nueva oportunidad.
texts.en:
Elba Alicia is sixty-one years old and lives in her own house with her husband and also her grandson, who is in school.  She is involved in the sales of beauty products including: a variety of lotions, creams, shampoo, makeup, and other items which her customers enjoy.  She is a very entrepreneurial woman who works hard to contribute to the household income and to be able to raise a little money so she can provide some necessities.

She has a location in the municipal market in the zone where she lives that is quite busy.  She has really struggled to keep her business afloat since there has always been great competition, and this makes her always attentive to improving her business.  She has been doing this for many years, so she already has many faithful customers who choose her every day because she is a very positive woman and honorable in her work.  She has chosen to ask for a loan from INTEGRAL because she wishes to invest in her business by buying new merchandise (lotions, creams, shampoo, makeup, etc.) which will help her to keep her business well-stocked and be up to date with the newest products that come on the market.  This is how she will be able to continue attracting the attention of a variety of customers, which will help her increase her margins and will give her the opportunity to create a better sort of life.  

She says that she is very thankful for this institution because they gave her help when she most needed it, that's how her business has been growing, little by little.  She hopes to get good results from this new investment opportunity.

loans.use: to buy lotions, beauty creams, shampoo, makeup, etc.

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Twibumbirehamwe/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Beatrice fait partie du groupe Twibumbirehamwe. Elle a 30 ans, elle est mariée avec 3 enfants de 2 ans à 10 ans, dont 2 scolarises. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Beatrice est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences sélectionnées et des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Beatrice voudrait être le premier agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Beatrice is part of the group Twibumbirehamwe. She is 30 years old and married, and she has three children, from 2 to 10 years old. Two of the children are in school. She has one person to support other than her children. She has a 6th grade education. 

Beatrice is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is her third one with the microfinance institution ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy some fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor.

Her strategy for the growth of her business is to use select seeds and chemical fertilizers for her rice farming. 

In the next few years, Beatrice would like to be the No. 1 farmer in the region. With the profits, she plans on educating her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Urpicha II, tiene 53 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comida, es madre de 6 hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años, ella nota que su vida esta cambiando tanto económicamente como personal, y ella lo agradece a las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal, para ella FINCA Perú es una organización que ayuda a las mujeres a progresar. Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de arroz,azúcar, aceite para su negocio.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Communal Bank "Urpicha II". She is 53 years old and the mother of six children. Eugenia sells food and has been a member of FINCA Peru for two years. She says that her life has changed financially and personally. Eugenia is grateful for the training classes she received from the Communal Bank. For her, FINCA Peru is an organization that helps women make progress.

The loan she is requesting now will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, and oil for her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Abesamihigo A /rsz Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco fait partie du groupe Abesamihigo A. Il a 53 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 10 ans à 33 ans, dont 6 scolarises. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Jean Bosco est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser la semence sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Bosco voudrait être le premier agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco is part of the group Abesamihigo. He is 53 years old and married, and he has six children, from 10 to 33 years old. All of them have had schooling. He has one person to support other than his children. He has 3 years of secondary education. 

Jean Bosco is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his third one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use the loan to buy some fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to use select seeds. In the next few years, Jean Bosco would like to be the No. 1 farmer in the region. With the profits, she plans on educating his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Abunzubumwe/ Kzh Group

texts.fr:
Torojani fait partie du groupe Abunzubumwe /Kzh. Il a 39 ans, il est marie avec 7 enfants de 1 an à 15 ans, dont 4scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire.
Trojani est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser la semence sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Trojani voudrait être le premier agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Torojani is part of the group Abunzubumwe /Kzh. He is 39 years old and married, and he has 7 children, from 1 to 15 years old. Four of the children are in school. He has six years of secondary education. 

Torojani is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his third one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use the loan to buy some fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to use select seeds. In the next few years, Torojani would like to be the No. 1 farmer in the region. With the profits, he plans on covering his children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Abaticamugambi/ Rhh Group

texts.fr:
Vénusté fait partie du groupe Abaticumugambi. Il a 46 ans, il est marie avec 4 enfants de 2 an à 9 ans, dont 1 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de secondaire.
Vénusté est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser la semence sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Vénusté voudrait être le grossiste des riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants et payer le frais médicaux.
texts.en:
Vénusté is part of the group Abaticumugambi. He is 46 years old and married, and he has four children, from 2 to 9 years old. He has five years of secondary education. 

Vénusté is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his second one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use the loan to buy some fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to use select seeds. In the next few years, Vénusté would like to be the wholesale merchant of rice. With the profits, he plans on covering his children's schooling and medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
This is Leona, 44, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Demetrio, a driver, and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Leona operates a meat stall. They buy meat from suppliers that deliver meat to market stalls. Her products are pork, beef meat and processed meat products. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of freshness and cleanliness. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional supplies of pork and beef meat needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Leona hopes that her business will continue to be successful, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and be finished with their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of meat needed in her business

loans.name: Twitekumurimo Group

texts.fr:
Emile fait partie du groupe Twitekumurimo. Il a 29 ans, il est marie avec 3 enfants de 3 an à 8 ans, dont 1 scolarise. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire.
Emile est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser la semence sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Emile voudrait être le premier agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants
texts.en:
Emile is part of the group Twitekumurimo. He is 29 years old and married, and he has three children, from 3 to 8 years old. He has one person to support other than his children. He has six years of secondary education. 

Emile is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his third one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use the loan to buy some fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to use select seeds. In the next few years, Emile would like to be the No. 1 farmer in his region. With the profits, he plans on covering his children's schooling expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Tezimberigihugu Group

texts.fr:
Germain fait partie du groupe Tezimberigihugu. Il a 45 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 6 ans à 18 ans, dont 3 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Germain est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser les semences sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Germain voudrait être un grand producteur riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Germain is part of the group Tezimberigihugu. He is 45 years old and married, and he has six children, from 6 to 18 years old. He has a 6th grade education. 

Germain is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his third one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use the loan to buy some fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to use select seeds. In the next few years, Germain would like to be a major rice producer in his region. With the profits, he plans on covering his children's education expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Maria Liliana

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 35 años de edad, conviviente con 3 hijos a su cargo, y vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el caserío Guaraguaos Alto, en el distrito de Tambogrande, en la zona rural, pero si cuenta con servicio de luz eléctrica.
La actividad a la que se dedica María es a la elaboración y venta de chicha de jora y de piqueos, los cuales puede repartir a domicilio, contando con clientela establecida para los dos negocios. Su conviviente es trabajador estable en un fundo de uva en Ica.
El monto del crédito es de 700 soles, los cuales se utilizarán para la mejora de la infraestructura de su negocio, para verse más vistoso, y atraiga muchos más clientes para el consumo de sus productos y por ende, para ayudar al mejoramiento de su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old.  She lives with her partner and is raising three children.  She lives in her own home, which is located in the hamlet of Guaraguaos Alto, in the district of Tambogrande.  It is in a rural area but it does get electric light service.

María makes a living making and selling chicha de jora (an ancestral drink of the Americas and a national drink of Peru, consisting of fermented corn)  and traditional snacks, which can be delivered to homes.  She relies on her established clientele for both businesses.  Her partner has a stable job at a vineyard in Ica.

The amount of the loan is 700 soles, which they will use to improve the infrastructure of their business, to make it more colorful, and to attract many more customers for the consumption of their products and as a result, to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of her business.

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El comité surge gracias a las promociones hechas en lo zona a las miembros, quienes quedaron encantadas con el programa y decidieron unirse, para que de esa forma puedan trabajar juntas y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La sra. Irene, es la presidenta del grupo. Ella junto con su familia tienen una mini microempresa que es la venta y cría de chanchos. Comenta que gracias a este trabajo su familia ha podido salir adelante y ayudarse los unos a los otros. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y que de esa forma su familia pueda tener lo que necesitan para el día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus chanchos, ya que no quiere que les falte para su alimento. Ella agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la ayuda que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank came about thanks to the promoting done in the member’s neighborhood. They were pleased with the program and decided to join together so that they could work together and help each other out. 

Irene is the president of the group. She and her family have a small business, which is selling and raising pigs. She explains that it is thanks to this work that her family has been able to get ahead and help each other. Her goal is to continue growing so that her family can have what it needs day to day.

She is requesting the loan to buy commercial feed for her pigs because she doesn’t want them to lack for food. She is grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the help she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las emprendedoras es un excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, está integrado por 12 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Actualmente se encuentran en el tercer ciclo, pero su meta es seguir trabajando juntas y de esa forma ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La presidenta del grupo es la Sra. Epifania, quien se dedica a la venta de verduras y nos comenta que con este trabajo ella ha podido mantener a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para el día a día. Su meta es agrandar su negocio y de esa forma poder ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tomates, locotes, cebollas, pepinas y demás verduras, lo que le ayudará a tener bien surtido su negocio. El grupo está muy agradecido con la fundación paraguaya y con Kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Enterprising Women group is an excellent group of women in the city of Itá. It is made up of 12 women, all of whom are friends and neighbors from this city. Currently, they are in their third loan cycle, but their goal is to continue working together and, in this way, to help each other out. 

The president of the group is Epifania, who sells vegetables. She explains to us that with this work she has been able to support her family and give them what they need day to day. Her goal is to expand her business so that she can offer a greater variety to her customers.

She is requesting the loan to buy tomatoes, bell peppers, onions, cucumbers, and other vegetables, which will help her to have her business well stocked. The group is very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, bell peppers, onions, cucumbers, and other vegetables

loans.name: Nereah

texts.en:
Nereah is a 53-year-old woman from Migori. She is married to Raphael and they have seven children.

She sells charcoal, a business she has done for the last five years, getting a monthly income of KES 7,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy more stock of charcoal to sell. She will use the profits to boost her charcoal stock.

Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To  buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Las Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
Las Virtuosas se denomina el buen grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que la actual presidenta la Sra. Delia contactó con la asesora en una reunión que tenía en la zona para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité. Actualmente el grupo tiene 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando en el primer ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Mariana es parte del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de joyas de todo tipo, como ser anillos, pulseras, cadenas y demás tipos. Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que siempre recibe muchos pedidos de sus clientes., y es por ello que le va muy bien.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de joyas con lo que podrá abastecerse y tener mayor variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Está muy contenta por esta oportunidad de progreso que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The “Las Virtuosas” group is a good group of women in the city of Itá. The current president, Delia, contacted the advisor in a meeting that took place in the neighborhood and informed herself of the work that the Committee does. Currently the group has 17 women, who are working on their first loan cycle together in a supportive way within the program. 

Mariana is a part of the group. She sells jewelry of all sorts, such as rings, bracelets, chains, and other things. She says that she has a good clientele because she always gets a lot of orders from her customers, and this is why things are going very well for her.

She is requesting the loan to buy jewelry so that she can stock up and have a greater variety to offer to her customers. She is very happy because of the opportunity for progress that she is receiving, because it will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal  Nueva Esperanza está formado por 9 socias quienes son mujeres hospitalarias, amables y de un corazón muy cálido, laboran en diferentes actividades, trabajos que le permiten solventar sus gastos personales y sacar adelante a sus familias para brindarles un mejor futuro. Viven por distintos lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta ciudad esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gran variedad en la gastronomía cautiva el paladar de sus habitantes y de sus visitantes, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Baltazara, tiene 45 años, es viuda y no tiene hijos, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. María Baltazara trabaja en una marisquería desde hace algunos años, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. En su casa cría vacas, cerdos y pollos a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.

Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir comprando pollos y alimento para los mismos.
 
Su meta es crecer en la cría de animales.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Esperanza” comunal bank is made up of 9 members who are hospitable and friendly women who have warm hearts. They work in different businesses, work which allows them to cover their personal expenses and help their families get ahead so they can provide them with a better future. They live in different areas of the city of Cuenca, which has been a World Heritage site since December 1999. This city is bathed by 4 rivers, its huge variety of cuisine captivates the palates of its inhabitants and visitors, and its residents preserve the culture and traditions of their peoples.

One of the members of this group is María Baltazara. She is 45 years old, a widow, and does not have children. The house she lives in is her own property.

María Baltazara has worked in a seafood restaurant for a few years. She works from Sunday to Sunday from 8:00 in the morning until 4:00 in the afternoon. At home she raises cows, pigs, and chickens, which she sells when has economic need. 

She is in her third loan cycle with the communal bank and she is going to use it to buy chickens and feed for them. 

Her goal is to grow her animal raising business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed for them

loans.name: Carlos Ivan

texts.es: Carlos Ivan tiene 27 años de edad, el trabaja en una empresas de la ciudad donde habita el posee una vivienda en el cual le quiere realizar algunas mejoras  a la vivienda pero por falta de dinero no las había realizado. Carlos tiene la ayuda de su mama que siempre lo ha apoyado en las decisiones que toma el joven, actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar materiales como arena, cemento, piedrín, zinc entre otros.
texts.en:
Carlos Ivan is 27 years old and works at a business in the city where he lives. He owns a home that is in need of a few repairs, but he lacks the money to make these renovations. Carlos has the help of his mother, who always supports the decisions he makes as a young man.

He is currently requesting a loan in order to buy materials such as sand, cement, gravel, zinc, and other materials.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, gravel, zinc, and other materials.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna es socia del Bancomunal Urpicha II, tiene 48 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa.Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 6 meses, es madre de 4 hijos, le gusta el sistema de trabajo de su Bancomunal porque sus ahorros están creciendo y porque las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal le ayudan a criar mejor a sus hijos y a administrar mejor su negocio,ella siente que está progresando y desea seguir haciéndolo para alcanzar sus metas. Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para su negocio.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the Communal Bank "Urpicha II". She is 48 years old and the mother of four children. Reyna sells clothing and has been a member of FINCA Peru for six months. She enjoys the work methods of her Communal Bank because her savings have grown. The training classes offered by her Communal Bank have helped her do a better job in raising her children and managing her business. She feels that she has made progress and wants to continue striving for her goals.

Reyna is now requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of clothing for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Primero De Marzo Group

texts.es:
El Comité Primero de Marzo es un comité indígena que integra el Programa Comité de Mujeres Rurales de la Fundación Paraguaya de la ciudad de Curuguaty. Está integrado por 14 señoras todas con muchos deseos de trabajar y salir adelante. 
Carmen es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, y comenta que gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles todo aquello que ellos necesitan para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Su meta es poder tener una mayor cantidad de animales, y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales y de esa forma poder tener en stock para que no le falte. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The committee Primero de Marzo is an indigenous group from the city of Curuguaty that is part of the Rural Women's Program at the Fundacion Paraguya. The group is made up of 14 women who want to work hard and come out ahead.

One of the members, Carmen, raises and sells animals. She says that thanks to her job she has been able to help her family and give them everything that they need to improve their living conditions. Her goal is to have more animals so that she can keep helping her family.

She asks for a loan to buy balanced feed for her animals so that she'll have it in stock and won't run out. She is grateful for the opportunity that she's getting because it will help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for animals.

loans.name: Santa Rita Group

texts.es:
Santa Rita es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está integrado por 18 mujeres de esta ciudad. El grupo está en el sexto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya y su meta es trabajar todas juntas y ayudarse las unas a las otras. 
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Mirtha, ella  tiene una despensa hace varios años, con lo cual ayuda con los gastos de su casa. Su negocio está en su propia casa lo que le ayuda mucho, comenta que empezó con un negocio muy pequeño, y que después gracias a su sacrificio ha ido creciendo. 
Cuenta la Sra. Mirtha que solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles en general, como ser fideos, yerba, azúcar, arroz y demás. Ellas están contentas por formar parte del programa de comité de mujeres.
texts.en:
The group Santa Rita is made up of 18 women from the city of Encarnacion. The group is in their sixth lending cycle with the program for businesswomen from the Fundacion Paraguaya. Their goal is to all work together and help each other.

One of the members, Mirtha, has had a grocery store for some years that helps with her household costs. Her business is in her home which is helpful. She says that she started with a very small business, and thanks to her sacrifice it has grown.

Mirtha asks for a loan to buy general goods like noodles, yerba, sugar, rice and other things. They are happy to be part of the women's committee program.

loans.use: to buy noodles, yerba, sugar, rice and other things.

loans.name: Pauteñitas  (Paute) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal  Las Pauteñitas esta formado por 9 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en diferentes lugares del Cantón Paute, lugar de clima templado en donde se cosecha una gran variedad de frutas, sus tierras son propicias para las plantaciones de flores, su gente también se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y comercio. Nuestras socias son gente hospitalaria y trabajadora que laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que le permiten tener independencia y solvencia económica lo mismo que les permite salir  adelante con sus familias y brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Miriam, tiene 49 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos, dos de sus hijos son casados y viven  independientes, sus tres hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente. Su esposo labora en la elaboración de calzado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en una hacienda que cuida.

Doña Miriam se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y trabaja desde hace 12 años  cuidando una hacienda, cría cuyes, pollos, cerdos y ganado a los que los vende en Paute, también se dedica a agricultura y lo que produce es para la venta y para su consumo. 

Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas para la agricultura y en más animales para la cría. 

Su meta es comprarse un terreno.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Pauteñitas comprises nine female members and one male. They live in different areas within the canton of Paute, which has a temperate climate and where a great variety of fruits are grown. The land is propicious for flower plantations. Its people also raise animals, farm, and trade. Our members are hospitable and hard-working people who work performing different activities, which allow them to be independent and financially solvent, as well as to get ahead with their families and offer their children a better future.

Miriam is one of the members of this group. She is 49 years old and married. She conceived five children from her marriage. Two of them are married and live independently, and her three unmarried children work and help her financially. Her husband is a shoemaker. She doesn't own a home, which is why she lives on a ranch, which she takes care of.

Miriam is a homemaker and for the past 12 years she has also worked taking care of a ranch. She raises guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and cattle, which she sells in Paute. She also farms, and what she produces is for consumption and for sale.

This is her third loan with the communal bank, and she is going to invest it in purchasing seeds for agriculture and more animals to raise.

Her goal is to purchase her own piece of land.

The small picture shows a member who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and animals.

loans.name: Margarita Cupertina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Colon se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros. En este lugar las personas se dedican a la agricultura en gran parte.

En este lugar vive la señora Margarita, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene siete hijos, los mismos que  ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella. Su marido se dedica a la agricultura. 

Ella desde muy joven aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad y después puso un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, allí  realiza una gran cantidad de obras, elabora prendas tanto masculinas como femeninas pero reconoce que más le gusta confeccionar ropa de mujer. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 la noche y  a veces se queda hasta la madrugada cuando tiene bastante trabajo. Sus obras entrega a un local de un Centro Comercial de Portoviejo. Lleva dedicada a esta actividad por más de 15 años y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres y otros materiales que se utilizan en la costura. Este es su sexto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que ofrece la institución.

Su aspiración es tener un taller de costura en el centro en Portoviejo.
texts.en:
The village bank Colon meets every 15 days in the parish of Colon in the city of Portoviejo, capital of the Manabi province. It is known as the City of the Valley because it's surrounded by many mountains. Most people here work in agriculture.

This is where Margarita, 56, lives. She is married and has 7 children who are all grown, but two of them still live at home. Her husband is a farmer.

Since she was young she learned to cut and make garments at a school in her town, and later she put a small sewing workshop in her home. She makes a lot of garments there, both men's and women's, though she prefers making women's clothing. She works every day from 9am to 9pm and sometimes stays up all night if she has a lot of work. She delivers her orders at a store in the mall in Portoviejo. She has been doing this for more than 15 years and it's going well.

This loan is to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and other sewing materials. This is her sixth cycle with the village bank and she likes it because of the benefits that the institution offers.

Her dream is to have a seamstress shop in the center of Portoviejo.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Lorna has a shop that sells vegetables and coconut. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 to buy coconut and fresh vegetables like okra, bitter melon, squash, and green leafy vegetables. She also sales spring onions and seasonings.
Lorna has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Lorna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Johny

texts.es: Johny, tiene la edad de 49 años,  está casado,  vive con sus 6 hijos  y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende asistir su cafetal con abonos, calcio y plaguicidas para obtener mejores resultados. E l cuenta con su cafetal en condiciones regulares pero quiere asistirlo para obtener de él esta próxima cosecha un mejor rendimiento en producción de café. El tiene como meta generar el máximo de las ganancias para su bienestar familiar y así tener cada día un mejor futuro económico. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Johny is 49, married, and lives with his wife and six children, who are his greatest priority. With the loan, he intends to help his coffee plantation with fertilizers, calcium and pesticides, in order to obtain better results.

His coffee plantation is in fairly good condition, but he wants to help it, in order to get a better yield in coffee production in this next harvest. His goal is to generate the maximum profit for his family's well-being, and this way have a better economic future each day.

This is the first loan he has received from Fudecosur. He hadn't had other loans from regular banks before, but Fudecosur has offered him the loan with better terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To help his coffee plantation produce more.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is a business woman. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for 4 years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy tomatoes, potatoes, and bananas for sale.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes, and bananas for sale

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is 68 years old with 10 children living in Hioma, Uganda. He has houses for rent from which he gets his income. His family goal is to educate his children who are still of school-going age. He hopes to hire employees in the future to help him in expanding his business. He intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Juphlied

texts.en: Juphlied is 31 years old and married with two children. She sells cereals to earn a living. She has been in the business for 6 years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to expand her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy beans, peas, maize, and rice for sale.

loans.use: To buy beans, peas, maize, and rice for sale

loans.name: Lorena Del Rocio

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Colon  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros. En este lugar las personas se dedican a la agricultura en gran parte.

En este lugar vive la señora Lorena, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y una linda jovencita de 16 años de edad la misma que estudia en colegio y es quien vive con ella.

Para salir adelante y con esto darles una buena educación a sus hijos le toco luchar mucho, ella tiene un negocio de cabinas telefónicas y un rstaurant en su casa, trabaja todos los días tanto en las cabinas telefónicas como en el restaurante, el mismo que lo abre los fines de semana ya que es en esos días cuando llegan más personas hasta su local, lleva con el negocio de las cabinas por más de 6 años y el comedor lo tiene 11 años. Gracias a sus negocios ella ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Con este crédito va a comprar víveres para la preparación de los alimentos, así como también productos que vende en sus cabinas como: jugos, sodas, dulces etc. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de tres años y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.

Su sueño es ver que su hija sea una profesional.
texts.en:
The Colon Community Bank meets every 15 days in the parish of Colon in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, known as the Ciudad de Valle (City in the Valley) because it is surrounded by hills.  In this area, people are agricultural workers to a great extent.

Here is the home of Lorena, 43 years old, who is the single mother of three children, two of whom are of age and one lovely young woman of 16 years who studies in high school and lives with her.

To move ahead and to give a good education to her children she has had to struggle greatly.  She has a telephone booth business and a restaurant in her house, and she works every day as much with the telephone booths as in the restaurant.  It's the same on weekends, since it's on those days that more people come to her place.  She's been working in the phone booth business for more than 6 years and the restaurant she's had for 11 years.  Thanks to her businesses she has been able to give her children a good start in life.

With this loan, she is going to buy ingredients for food preparation, and also the products she sells in the booths, like juices, sodas, sweets, etc.  She's been part of the Communal Bank for more than three years and she likes it because of the ease of getting loans.

Her dream is to see her daughter become a professional.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, juices, sodas, candies, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Kuña Guapa” están en el Primer ciclo  con  20  integrantes, ellas se unieron al programa de la fundación para poder seguir creciendo y ayudar a sus hijos y familiares por medio de su trabajo. 
Mercedes es miembro del grupo, y ella se dedica a las ventas, tiene una despensa, en la cual trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día y termina ya muy noche. El deseo de Mercedes es seguir trabajando para poder seguir ayudando a su familia. Ella solicita el crédito para poder abastecer su negocio con bebidas, comestibles, enlatados, carnes y demás productos, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda. Ella y el grupo agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The committee named "Kuña Guapa" is in its first loan cycle with 20 members. They joined the program with Fundación Paraguaya so they could continue growing and helping their children and relatives through their work.

Mercedes is a member of this group. She manages a food pantry where she conducts her sales. Mercedes begins her work in the early morning hours and finishes at night. She wants to continue working so that she can help her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to restock her business with beverages, snacks, canned goods, meats, and other products, which will be a great help.

Mercedes and the rest of her group are grateful for the opportunity they have received from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy beverages, snacks, canned goods, meats, and other products.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Kuña Guapa, se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora  Sebastiana. El grupo se encuentra en el primer ciclo, con 10 integrantes, donde todas ellas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de cooperación y ayuda mutua.
Elida es miembro de este grupo, ella se dedica a la cría y venta de animales. Comenta que este es un trabajo muy duro porque tiene que estar pendiente  de sus animales las 24 hs. Del día. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante, siempre gracias a su trabajo.
Ella pide a kiva y a la fundación paraguaya un crédito para la compra de balanceados, lo cual podrá tener en stock, para que no se le acabe. Ellas están contentas de formar parte del grupo, pues es muy útil para todas.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Guapa was formed with the initiative of Sebastiana. The group is in its first loan cycle, with 10 members, where they work together within an environment of cooperation and mutual assistance.

Elida is a member of this group; she raises and sells animals. She says that this is very hard work because she has to keep an eye on her animals 24 hours of the day. She describes herself as a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead, always thanks to her work. 

She is requesting a loan from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya to buy animal feed, which she will be able to have in stock so it does not run out. These women are glad to be part of the group, as it is very useful for all of them.

loans.use: to buy feed for animals.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
This is Loreta, 60, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a widow with five children.  She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Loreta operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Aside from this, she sells dried fish for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Loreta hopes her business grows and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is a 28-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children and building a permanent home. He has been running a beer and soda depot for the last two years after starting with capital of 500,000 UGX. Now his business is worth 3,000,000 UGX. His major hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock. He has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming and expanding his business to new markets. Justus wants a loan to buy beer and soda for resale.

loans.use: to buy beer and sodas for resale.

loans.name: Drocela

texts.en: Drocela is 30 years old. She is married with one child who is five years old. She sells clothes and bed sheets. She has been in this business for five years. She has requested a loan to add more bed sheets. She plans to use the profits for building a house.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 35 years old and a single mother of four children. She has a business selling clothes and she has been running it for seven years. She faces the challenges of seasonal variations and high fuel costs. Her family goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to expand to new markets.She also wishes to diversify her business by selling shoes. Beatrice intends to buy clothes to sell and clear school fees for her children with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell and clear school fees for her children

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El señor José tiene  50 años de edad, está casado hace 26 años con la señora Arminda de 43 años, el matrimonio tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos ya mayor. 
El Sr. José tiene su negocio de despensa y carnicería desde hace 18 años, cuenta con clientela formada y es ayudado por su señora, juntos se ayudan a llevar adelante este negocio, también su hijo menos trabaja en el negocio familiar y con esto tiene la posibilidad de terminar sus estudios.                                                                                         Solicita este préstamo para la compra de azúcar, aceite, carnes, chorizo, yerba, arroz y otros artículos que le permitirá ofrecer variedad  a sus clientes y así poder mejorar sus ingresos mensuales.
texts.en:
José is 50, and has been married for 26 years to Arminda, 43. The couple has two children, one of them already an adult. 

José has had his grocery store and butcher shop for 18 years, and has an established clientele. His wife helps him, and together they help one another keep this business going. As well, their younger son works in the family business, and with this has the chance to finish his studies.                                                                                         

He is applying for this loan in order to buy sugar, cooking oil, meats, sausage, yerba mate tea, rice, and other items that will allow him to offer variety to his customers and enable him to improve his monthly income.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, meats, sausage, yerba mate tea, rice and other items.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 40 years old and single with two school-going children. She has been running a restaurant for six years and gets a monthly income of 14,000 shillings.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more food items such as maize meal, wheat flour, sugar, fresh fruits and vegetables from farmers to use to make food in the restaurant to sell to her customers. In the future, she wants to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items such as maize meal, wheat flour, sugar, fresh fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en: Annastacia is 48 years old and a mother of three children. She sells second hand clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to expand her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernan es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 25 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, asimismo se le conoce por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país, el cual es la Laguna de Huacachina, asimismo es una zona donde una de sus actividades principales es la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago y uva. Como buen peruano a Hernan le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”. 

Con mucha dedicación Hernan trabaja en su negocio como chofer de moto de carga; trabaja alrededor de 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes en el día, ya que el transporta carga pesada en especial cargamento de verduras, frutas, entre otros, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es responsable y cumplido con sus clientes, pro ello siempre lo recomiendan y sobre todo porque hace un buen trabajo a un buen precio.

Hernan está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento y reparación para su moto carga como  refuerzo de muelles y cambio de amortiguadores, lo que le permitirá tener un vehículo en buen estado para realizar sus labores y poder mejorar sus ingresos, así el seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Hernan is a hardworking gentleman. He is 25 years old and lives in the city of Ica, a place that is known for its warm climate throughout the entire year. It is also for the Huacachina Lagoon, one of the most well-known tourist attractions in the country. One of the main business activities in this area is agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton, asparagus, and grapes. Being a good Peruvian, Hernan greatly enjoys traditional food. One of his favorite dishes is the flavorful "ají de gallina" (chicken with peppers).

With great dedication, Hernan works at his business as a motorized tractor driver. He works approximately 12 hours a day and is able to serve 10 customers each day. Hernan transports heavy cargo, especially shipments of vegetables, fruits, and other items. He believes he is doing very well in his business because he is responsible and polite to his customers. Hernan always receives recommendations because he does a good job at a good price.

He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for the assistance they have provided. Hernan plans to maintain and repair his motorized tractor by reinforcing the springs and replacing the shock absorbers. This will enable him to have a stable vehicle for performing his work so that he can improve his income. Hernan continues to strive toward his greatest dream of having a house of his own.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Hachem

texts.en:
Hachem is a 34-year-old married man with two children. He has worked in the construction field for 22 years. He is an expert in his field. He was only 12 years old when he started working to help his parents make their living. He hopes to provide his children with a better living and he hopes they will live a happy childhood, unlike his.

Hachem is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary sand and pebbles for a requested project. Hachem also sells and transports construction sand and pebbles when requested. 

This is Hachem's first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower. He hopes it comes with positive feedback on his social and financial situations.

loans.use: To buy sand and pebbles for a requested project

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a married mother living in Hoima, Uganda. She owns a business selling clothes and she faces the challenges of high fuel and transport costs. Her family goal is to educate her children and expand her business to new markets. Monica intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 23 years old. She sells foodstuffs such as rice, salt, beans and sugar. She has been running this business for three years. With the loan, she wants to add more of the above-mentioned foodstuffs to her existing business. The profits from the business will be used to make more investments in the business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, salt, beans and sugar to sell.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre San Miguel, está como grupo desde el año 2007, son  18 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 11º ciclo. Ellas son todas amigas y se ayudan siempre para que por medio del trabajo de todas puedan ayudar a su familia y ayudarse las unas a las otras. 
Una de las miembros es la señora Tomasa, ella es una persona que se destaca por ser muy trabajadora y emprendedora, su meta siempre ha sido trabajar y ayudar a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo y gracias a eso y a su arduo trabajo ha podido ayudar a su familia. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas, con lo que podrá abastecer su negocio, y de esa forma tener mayor variedad que poder dar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Committee of Women named "San Miguel" has been existence as a group since 2007. The group consists of 18 women who enjoy working and are participating in their eleventh loan cycle. They are all friends and are always cooperative when they work because they want to help their families and one another.

One of the members is Sra. Tomasa. She is a person who is known for being an entrepreneur and a hard worker. Her goal has always been to work and help her family. Tomasa sells clothing of all types. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to help her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy clothing to restock her business. As a result, she will have more variety to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en: Marie Rose is 28. She sells skirts and blouses for ladies. She has been running this business for the past six years. With the loan, she wants to add more skirts and blouses to the existing business. The profits from the business will be used to build a house for living. She wants her business to prosper in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr  Juan tiene  38 años, está casado con la Sra Maria de 40 años, tienen dos hijos varones, por quienes luchan para poder darles siempre lo mejor. 
El Sr Juan cuenta con un pequeño tambo lechero semi moderno, él ayudado por sus hijos y su señora diariamente desde bien temprano ordeñan sus vacas para vender la leche a su clientela que todos los días les esperan desde muy tempranas horas. Esta es una familia muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante y progresar. 
El Sr Juan solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus vacas, con lo cual podrá tener en stock una buena cantidad de alimentos para ellas para que no les falte. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues le será muy útil.
texts.en:
Juan is 38 years old and married to Maria, 40 years old. They have two sons, for whom they always struggle to give the best. Juan has a small, semi-modern dairy farm. His two sons and his wife help him daily at the dairy farm. Very early in the morning they milk the cows to be able to sell the milk to their customers, who wait for them very early in the morning. This is a very hardworking family who wishes to get ahead in life and advance themselves.

Juan is asking for a loan to buy animal feed for his cows so that he may have a good quantity of food in stock for them, so they aren't hungry. He appreciates the help that he is receiving with the loan and it will be useful for him.

loans.use: purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is 36 years old and married with two children. He runs a car transport business (taxi) to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy tires for his car.

loans.use: To buy tires for his car

loans.name: Chimed

texts.en:
Chimed is a 38-year-old man who lives with his wife and four children, which are 2, 4, 12, 14 years old in Uvurhangai province of Central Mongolia.  His wife is sales goods in local market and two children study in secondary schools. He started a garment retail business in 2007. He purchases products from China and his wife works as a shop assistant at the shop counter. He usually sells men's and women's casual clothes. He has experience running these types of businesses and is planning to expand the business activity. 

Chimed is a hardworking man who says, "I would like to develop the business activity by purchasing garments in different styles from a wholesalerto save on transportation expense and increase the volume." The total amount he is requesting is 600,000 MNT to purchase garments.

loans.use: To purchase garments

loans.name: Twibumbirehamwe Group

texts.fr:
Aloys fait partie du groupe Twibumbirehamwe. Il a 78 ans, il est marie avec 7 enfants de 50 ans à 33 ans. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Aloys est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser la semence sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Aloys voudrait être le premier agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d'améliorer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aloys is part of the group Twibumbirehamwe. He is 78 years old and married, and he has 7 children, from 33 to 50 years old. He has one person to support other than his children. He has three years of secondary education. 

Aloys is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his third one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use the loan to buy some fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to use select seeds. In the next few years, Aloy would like to be the No. 1 farmer in the region. With the profits, he plans on improving his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
This is Caridad, 59, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Caridad operates a broom retailing business. She sells walis tingting, which is a native Filipino broom made from palm leaf midribs. What she basically does is buy her products from wholesalers and sell them individually for a profit. Customers are attracted to them due to the low selling prices that she offers. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 17,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Caridad dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for brooms needed in her business

loans.name: Naili

texts.en:
Naili is 38 years old. She lives in a small village of Kvareli District with her family: her mother (retired), her elder brother and her 15-year-old niece who goes to school. At the moment Naili is the only income provider in the family. She works as a laborer in the village. Mainly Naili works on seasonal agricultural jobs. The total average monthly income of the family is 210 Laris. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. 

Naili used to run a family farming business. In particular, she used to grow melons on a family-owned plot of land. Last year, she had to stop this business because she didn’t have financial resources for financing seasonal agricultural work. Now her loan request has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with easy conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Naili will cultivate the land and purchase melon seeds, as well as fertilizer. She will sow melons and work hard on the plot during the spring season. After properly done seasonal work, Naili will get a good harvest in summer. She will sell harvested products to local retailers. The income of the family will increase. 

Naili plans to save some funds for sowing more melons next year. The living conditions of the family will improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase melon seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 39 years old. He lives in a small village in Telavi District, East Georgia. This region is known for its well-developed agriculture. Zaza lives with his family: wife Khatuna, parents (retired) and two children (5 and 1.5 years old). 

Zaza is the only income provider in the family. He is a worker in a local factory. The family also has a small vineyard. Zaza produces wine and sells it in the village. The family's average monthly income is 400 GEL, which includes the pensions of Zaza’s parents. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs in the subsistence poor category. 

Zaza requested credit to start an agricultural business. He will purchase calves and raise them for five months. After this period Zaza will sell grown calves and earn a profit. His loan request was approved through a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit to start-up and re-startup businesses with fewer restrictions. This program is designed for the country's rural poor, who are considered “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the credit Zaza will start the business, which will provide additional income to the family. Calves will be placed in an old cattle shed located in Zaza’s yard. The average monthly income of the family will increase by 200 GEL, which will mean a 50% increase. The living conditions of the family will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Deudonne

texts.en: Deudonne is 28 years old. He is married to a businesswoman.  They have one child who is seven months old. He sells foodstuffs like rice, sugar and beans. He has spent three years in the business. He has requested the loan to buy more rice and beans to sell. With the profits from the business, he will make more investments in the business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and beans to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 44-year-old married man living in Hoima, Uganda. Together the couple has eight children who are all of school-going age. He is a farmer and has been farming for over 10 years but faces challenges of high fuel and transport costs coupled with customers who don't pay on time. His family goal is to educate his children and buy a car. His business goal is to diversify his business and buy land to grow crops. Ali intends to use the loan for pay for labor and buy seeds for planting.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed is 35 years old. He is married. He has spent seven years running his business selling rice, sugar and beans.  With the loan, he wants to buy more sugar, rice and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for the rent on the house he uses for the business. He wants the business to prosper in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 23 years old. He lives in a small village of Baghdati District, West Georgia. David lives with his parents and grandmother (retired). The only source of the income for the family is their small-scale agricultural business. They have a vineyard with 300 grape vines and 70 nut trees. David and his father produce wine. They sell wine and nuts in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 210 Laris, including the pension of David’s grandma. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

David requested credit for start-up of a trade business. He will purchase cheap cars in Europe and sell them in Georgia for a higher price. It will give additional income to the family. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with easy conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Alex will purchase a car in Europe and sell it in Georgia for a higher price. For the first time David will reinvest the total profit in the same business to increase the turnover.  In the long term, the living conditions of the family will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car in Europe for resale in Georgia

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 65 years old. She lives in a village of Martvili District, West Georgia with her family: her son, daughter-in-law and 4-year-old grandson. Liana is retired. The only source of the income for the family is a small-scale agricultural business. They have a dairy farm with two milk cows. Liana produces cheese and sells on average 40 kg of this product on local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 350 Laris, including Liana’s pension. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Liana requested credit for start-up of a grocery business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with easy conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit Liana will start to sell greengrocery products. She will use the credit for purchasing fruit and vegetables from local farmers at wholesale prices and sell them in nearby towns with a price mark-up. Her son will help her. 

They will use the family-owned car for transportation of the products. The income of the family will increase by 200 – 250 Laris per month, which will mean a 55 – 65 % increase. The living conditions of the family will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase greengrocery products for resale

loans.name: Ucha

texts.en:
Ucha is 27 years old. He lives in Telavi District with his father. Ucha works in a local store as an auto parts salesperson. His salary of 400 Laris per month is the only source of the income for the family. According to Credo, estimations the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. 

Ucha is requesting a loan, which he will use to start up an agricultural business. His loan request is part of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re start-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit as “high risk borrowers.”  

With the loan, Ucha will purchase 15 calves. He will place the calves in the cattle shed, located in his yard. After half a year, Ucha will sell the grown calves and earn a profit. For the first year, Ucha plans to reinvest the profit in the same business to expand it and make it more profitable. As the family will have additional income, their living conditions will significantly improve and have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 35-year-old married father of two children. For less than a year now, he has been hired to manage a sandwich restaurant based on his vast experience in the business. In a short time, Ahmad succeeded in building a good reputation for the restaurant in the area, running it with dedication, integrity and quality service.

Ahmad is applying for a loan from Kiva’s Partner, Al Majmoua to buy a car. He will use this car for delivering sandwiches across his neighborhood as well as for personal use. It is essential for Ahmad to augment his business and add to its reputation. In the future, he intends to buy the restaurant, thus attaining a stable business and sustainable source of income for himself and his family. 

This is Ahmad's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. He is very optimistic about it, since his previous loan helped a lot in improving his business.

loans.use: to buy a car necessary for his business

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is married with two children. Cerila is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Cerila sells snacks like cassava cake, banana cake and hotcakes. In addition, she sells yema and peanut roll to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks such as condensed milk, sugar, flour, peanuts and cheese.

Cerila has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cerila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw  ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Telman

texts.en:
Telman, 64 years old, lives in a small village in Telavi District with his wife Marine and 20-year-old son. Telman works as a night-watchman in a village vineyard, earning a monthly salary of 130 Laris, the family's only income. According to Credo estimations, they belong to the vulnerable poor category.

Telman has requested a loan to start an agricultural business. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup loans with soft conditions to country rural poor who, because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income, do not have access to credit products.

With the loan, Telman will purchase six calves, placing them in the old cattle-shed located in his yard. After six months, he will sell the grown calves for a profit. For the first year Telman plans to reinvest the profit in the business to expand it and make it more profitable. As the family will have additional income, their living conditions will significantly improve, and they will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is 62 years old. He lives in Kvareli District, East Georgia with his wife, Manya, and his 4-year-old grandson. Manya is retired. Zaur is busy with agriculture. The family owns a small vineyard. Zaur produces wine and sells it in the village. The family's total average monthly income, including Manya’s pension, is 200 Laris. This places the family in the category of the vulnerable poor according to Credo estimations. 
	

Zaur used to run a family farming business. In particular, he used to grow melons on a family-owned plot of land. Five years ago, he had to stop this business, because he didn’t have the financial resources to cover seasonal agricultural needs. Now his loan request has been approved in a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides start-up and re-startup funding with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products due to their “high risk borrowers” classification, which is because of their low income. 


With this received credit, Zaur will rent a tractor to cultivate the land, purchase seeds of melons, and purchase fertilizers. He will seed the melons and work hard on the plot during the spring season. After properly done seasonal work, Zaur will get a good harvest in summer. He will sell harvested products to local retailers. The income of the family will increase. Zaur plans to save some funds for sowing more melons next year. The living conditions of the family will improve, providing the family with enough income to access regular credit products available within the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to rent a tractor for land cultivation, purchase melon seeds, and purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, membre d’une association de crédit, jeune femme  courageuse, entrepreneur, divorcé,âgée de 31 ans. La cliente est mère de 3 jeunes enfants (deux garçons et une fille),qui étudient à l’école primaire.En dépit de tout, elle (la cliente) supporte seule ses enfants. Elle est  sociétaire d’un restaurant. Elle a également un Kiosque de  vente de pièces motos. Elle commença le petit commerce par la vente d’objet luxueux (chainette, bijoux, bagues) sur la rue. Plus tard, elle fut informée de micro crédit qu’octroi l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, elle bénéficia son premier crédit de 50$ pour renforcer ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses  enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  9eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  d’acheter 2 sacs de haricots, pomme de terre, huile, Fanta, Primus, etc., pour renforcer son restaurant.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et acheter une parcelle dans le futur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
The client, age 31, is a member of a loan association.  She is a young and courageous entrepreneur who is divorced, aged 31 years old. She is the mother of 3 young children (two boys and a girl), who attend primary school. Despite it all, she takes care of her children. She works with others in a restaurant.  She also has a stall where she sells motorcycle parts. 

She started her retail business by selling luxury items (small chains, jewelry, rings) in the streets. Later she learned that microcredit was available through the microfinance institution Hekima.  This is how she received her first loan of 50 USD, which allowed her to strengthen her business.  The profits from her activity help her to put some money into savings, to feed her children and pay for their school fees.  

She has just obtained her ninth loan.  During that time period, she has seen her business prosper. This is why she has decided to request a larger loan amount for this new cycle.  With this loan she will be buying two bags of beans, some potatoes, oil, Fanta, Primus etc., to boost her restaurant activity.  She would also like to see her children grow, and to buy a plot of land in the future.  She thanks Hekima for helping low-income women become autonomous.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of beans, some potatoes, oil, Fanta, Primus, etc.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad has been farming a plot of land in Gaza since 2008. It is in an area well known for its fertile soils. Ahmad’s loan will allow him to purchase a new irrigation system. This will help protect his peas from drought, increase the output of his farm, and increase his income. Ahmad is 25 years old and unmarried. His goals for the future are to start a family and provide well for it.

loans.use: to purchase a new irrigation system

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is 26 years old and a married woman; she is a mother of two children. She lives in Al Salt, Jordan.

Rawan is looking to have a loan of 500 JDs so she can buy furniture she needs in her home.

Rawan is under 30 years old, so her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her home

loans.name: Ahmad
