Olivia sells bananas on a retail basis at the market and has been in this business for one year, working seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. Olivia's goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Peter, who is in his mid twenties, is married with one child. He has had a poultry business for two years now.  He works from 6.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy chicken feed and cover household expenses and has paid back his loan successfully. He wants a loan to buy more chicken feed for his poultry business. His dream is to one day be able to open a retail shop.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Juhudi" which has a total of fifteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feed.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Adeline is 36 years old, married to a house builder, and has three children who attend school.  She owns a store where she sells bed sheets. 

Adeline is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more bed sheets to sell. With the profits, she plans to pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: to purchase bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He aspires to open a shop in future. For the past year, Ali has been selling fuel from home. Other sources of income include his wife’s earnings, and she describes high transport costs to be her major challenge. Ali owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Ali plans to purchase more jerrycans of fuel using this loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). He joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more jerrycans of fuel.

loans.name: Bosembo Plus Group

texts.en:
Kikadi aged twenty-nine, is the leader of the Community Bank named “Bosembo Plus”, which is composed of twenty members united in solidarity to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Kikadi has been in his business for some years. He operates a drugstore in the eastern part of Kinshasa. He likes it and he is working hard to achieve his dream of someday opening a larger medicine facility to sell medicine to retailers. He intends to use the next loan to buy more medicine needed by his customers in his area to resell with the aim of increasing his profits. Each week, his business brings in a profit of about US$80. 

Kikadi is single.

loans.use: to purchase medicine needed by his customers.

loans.name: Cheikh Ab.kh

texts.fr: Cheikh est un jeune marié sans enfant.Il tient une boutique de vente de téléphone portables et d'accessoires. Il a arrété ses études il y a 5 ans faute de moyens de les poursuivre. Il a ouvert alors cette boutique avec l'aide de son oncle.Il parvient à générer des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter des portables et des accessoires téléphoniques. Son ambition est d'agrandir son commerce.
texts.en: Cheikh is a young married man with no children. He has a small shop selling mobile phones and accessories. He ended his studies five years ago due to a lack of funding. Therefore he opened this store with his uncle's help. He manages to generate a fairly consistent income which means he can support his family and cover their living costs. In order to increase his working capital, he is seeking a loan of 300,000f to purchase mobile phones and phone accessories. His ambition is to grown his business.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 22 years old, married, and has one child. She sells costumes for men and skirts for ladies, which she has been doing for four years. 

Pauline is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more costumes for men because she has realized that more men need costumes.

loans.use: to purchase costumes for men and skirts for ladies.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with one child. She has been selling cashew nuts at the market for the past two years. She describes seasonality as her major challenge, and food as her greatest expense during the month. Halima aspires to open a shop in the future. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

With the KES 20,000, she intends to purchase sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 33 and the mother of three children who are between ten months and seven years in age. Two of her children go to school.

For the past ten years Yvonne has sold clothes such as trousers, dresses and skirts. She is requesting a 500,000 RWF loan from UOB to buy more clothes to sell.

Yvonne’s profits will be used to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to  buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Esaïe Plus Group

texts.en:
Moseka, aged forty-eight, is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Esaïe Plus”. It is composed of twenty members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Moseka has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1982. She sells Shikwanges (kind of bread made from manioc flour) which is one of the main foods in Kinshasa. Her business is in the middle of developing progressively. The loan she’ll obtain next will be used to buy a larger quantity of shikwanges in bulk to resell retail with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $40 per week. Moseka is married and the mother of eight children aged between six and twenty-eight years old, of whom six attend school.

loans.use: to purchase shikwanges (type of bread) in bulk so as to resell them at profit.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronica is fifty-six years old. She is single and all her children are grown up, not depending on her. She is a poultry farmer and has been in the business for the past twelve years.

This is her first loan. She was brought to KADET Ltd. by a staff member. She will use the loan amount to purchase chicken feed and a stock of chicks to rear. She hopes to become a renowned poultry distributor in her area.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and and more chicks to rear.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña guapa es de la ciudad de Concepción, es un grupo integrado por 20 mujeres, todas jefas de familia, que se unieron con el objetivo de trabajar juntas y por medio del trabajo en conjunto ayudarse las unas a las otras. 
 Clotilde es parte de este grupo, y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y con un gran espíritu de superación, es por ello que lucha incansablemente para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con lo cual podrá surtir su local y atraer a más clientes. Ellas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de fundación paraguaya y de Kiva.
texts.en:
“Kuña Guapa” is from the city of Concepción; it’s a group made up of 20 women, all heads of household, who joined together with the goal of working together and through their teamwork help each other out.

Clotilde is part of this group and she comments that she works selling all sorts of clothes.  She is a very hardworking person with a great spirit of self-improvement which is why she strives tirelessly in order to improve her and her family’s living conditions.  She asks for the loan to buy clothes to stock her locale and attract more customers.

They are grateful for this opportunity they are getting from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is requesting a new loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of milk and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions and her children's education.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este comité es un grupo muy activo y unido, a pesar de tener algunos inconvenientes siempre saben salir adelante. Actualmente este grupo se encuentra en el ciclo número once, tienen ahorros para poder ayudarse con cualquier inconveniente. 
La Sra. Maxima es una de las miembros, ella tiene una pequeña despensa que a través del tiempo ha ido creciendo con su esfuerzo y también gracias a la  Fundación Paraguaya. Cuenta que está casada y tiene hijos, y todos ellos a ayudan con su negocio. 
Solicita el crédito para poder abastecer su local con verduras, fideos, arroz, azúcar, jabones, carnes, panificados y demás productos, ya que estos son los que más salidas tienen. Están contentas con la oportunidad de crecimiento que están recibiendo de la fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
This committee is a very united, active group.  Despite having some inconveniences they always find the way to get ahead.  The group is currently in its 11th cycle and they have savings to help get through any inconvenience.

Máxima is one of the members.  She has a small grocery store which has grown in time thanks to her efforts and help from Fundación Paraguaya.  She comments that she’s married and has children and all help with the business.

She’s asking for the loan to stock her store with vegetables, noodles, rice, sugar, soap, meat, baked goods and other products which are the ones that sell the best.  They are happy with the growth opportunity they are getting from Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Juan Pablo Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JUAN PABLO II” iniciará su sexto ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Virginia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: sopa de fideo, tienda de barrio, venta de cosméticos, venta de plásticos, venta de neumáticos, venta de pescado, venta de coca, venta de comida.

La señora Virginia, indica que hace tres años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de pescado que viene trabajando hace años, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su capital, (compra de pescado), mismo que comprará de la ferias de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Juan Pablo II communal bank will start its sixth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional office.  It is comprised of eight members, and it is run by a board of directors, which Virginia heads.  The members carry out various business activities.  Among them we have noodle soup, neighborhood store, selling cosmetics, selling plastics, selling tires, selling fish, selling coca leaves, and selling food.

Virginia says that she has been a member of the communal bank with Pro Mujer for three years.  She joined by invitation from a friend.  Virginia currently has a business of processing and selling fish.  She has been doing this for years, and she learned from her mother.

She will now use the loan to buy fish.  She will buy fish at the fairs in the city of El Alto, and she will later sell them at her fixed site.  This loan helps her to support her family.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health trainings and the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
Annabella is 40 years old and married with 2 children.  

Annabella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.  She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from hog raising.

Annabella has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. Annabella aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Mamoud

texts.en:
This is 47 year-old Mamoud.  He is married and has 3 children aged 4, 9 and 13. He has 2 additional dependents, who live with him to help his wife with the house chores.  

In 1992, Mamoud established his briefcase and suitcase business. He began his business after coming from the mines and he wanted to be self-reliant. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,755,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Mamoud has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional briefcases and suitcases to sell. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Mamoud plans to move from spreading his merchandise on the floor to a shop.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy briefcases and suitcases to sell

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison has applied for his third loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the new loan amount to buy more goods like sugar, salt, flour, and soap for sale in his retail shop. 

In the future, Harrison hopes to grow his retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: restock his store

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 48 years old. He has spent eight years running a boutique. In the boutique he sells different items such as sugar and rice. 

He has requested a loan to buy more rice and sugar. Joseph plans to use the profits for to reinvest in the existing business.

loans.use: To buy more rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 23 years old. He is married to Caroline and together they have one child. He operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the past two years.

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.  He will use the amount to purchase stocks of cooking fat and sugar for his business.  He hopes to own a supermarket in the near future.

loans.use: buy fat and sugar to sell

loans.name: Sao I.

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Sao.  She is married and has 4 children aged 2, 5, 8 and 14. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her to assist her in-law with her child's education.  

In 2007, Sao established her used clothing business. She began her business to help her husband in the maintenance of their home and children. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. 

Sao would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional used clothing. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. In the future, Sao plans to expand from a stall to a shop, because her stall is not well covered, and business is disturbed when it rains.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Micahel

texts.en:
Michael  is a 65-year-old married man. He has 7 children with ages ranging from 18 years to 35 years. He describes himself to be God-fearing and honest.

Michael operates a restaurant where he sells tea, snacks and food. He has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 3 staff members. His business is located within a fast-growing slum. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the restaurant. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy utensils. 

Michael's dream and  business goal is to run a big hotel. He hopes that in the future, he will own a plot of land.

loans.use: buy utensils for his restaurant

loans.name: Abdul Rahim

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Abdul.  He is married, and has 4 children aged 2, 5, 8 and 14. He has 1 additional dependent, who lives with him to help his sister with her child's education.  

In 2007, Abdul established his used clothing business. He began his business to make himself self-reliant and to care for the needs of his family. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,800,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Abdul has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional used clothing. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. 

In the future, Abdul plans to expand to the outskirts of town by opening another shop for his brother.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy used clothing to resell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Hawa.  She is married and has 3 children aged 21, 17, and 14, all are schooling. 

In 1997, Hawa established her textile and plastic shoes business. She began her business because she wanted to provide assistance to her relatives and children without bothering her husband and this is one of her source of income. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. 

Hawa would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy plastic shoes, wax cotton and material cotton. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000.  In the future, Hawa plans to acquire a shop, to start selling in Conakry, and to educate her children.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy textiles and plastic shoes to resell

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina has been in mixed farming for five years doing mainly dairy and poultry and providing for her family needs both from her farming income and a milling business she runs within the local market. Her farm is currently run with the help of one farmhand.

Selina has requested a first loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She aspires to grow the two businesses to a level where she will be able to adequately provide for her family of seven children who are all in school.

She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loan services for the impact they have had in the lives of smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 52 years old, married, and has six adult children. She is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya. She has been farming for over six years and currently runs her farm which produces milk, vegetables, and maize.  She employs one farmhand.

Annah is requesting a loan for 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to buy and insure a dairy cow. She states that the farming income has been her source of income for the six years she has been actively farming and now aspires to own three quality dairy cows and a motorcycle to help in transporting her produce to the market. Annah's challenges in farming are animal diseases and the high cost of their feeds especially during dry seasons.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a father of ten children, seven of whom are still at school and three who are now adults who are fully independent. He has carried out farming for twenty-seven years. He currently runs a mixed farm which produces mostly maize and beans which are both sold in the local markets to meet the family's basic needs.

John has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him boost his poultry business. He is glad to have learned more skills in poultry and is hopeful he will grow the business so that it can sustain his family well. He also hopes to have a large quantity of poultry so he can also sell in more distant markets. His major objective remains educating his children.

John laments the poor infrastructure and poor market prices for farm produce.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a mother of five children who are all adults.  She is in farming, producing maize, beans and eggs, which she sells in the local markets.

Hellen has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.  She says improved farming income will enable her to be independent.  She will have milk for her consumption and for resale to buy other basic needs.

She says challenges in farming include lack of facility for better storage, which compels farmers to sell their produce at low prices during peak season, and animal diseases, which are costly to manage.   She is glad Juhudi Kilimo is loaning to farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Psaumes 23 Plus Group

texts.en:
“Psaumes 23 Plus” is a group of 20 owners of small businesses chaired by Paul. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Paul’s main activity is to sell bicycle spare parts in his area located east of Kinshasa. He has been in the micro enterprise world for years. He has acquired solid experience in this business. Due to the high demand of his customers, Paul intends with the next loan to buy more bicycle spare parts in bulk and resell them at profit in order to generate additional profits. Currently, Paul makes a profit of US$240 per month. His ambition is to someday open a bicycle and spare parts shop to meet the people's needs in the surrounding area. Paul is 46 years old, married, and has six children between 9 and 20 years old. Three of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase more bicycle spare parts to resell in order to increase his working capital

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr:
Kossivi est un homme âgé de 28 ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants.
Kossivi travaille comme photographe caméraman depuis 2003. Il sert ses clients dans leurs lieux respectifs.  Sa difficulté est qu’il n’a pas un lieu fixe pour s’installer. Il veut ce prêt pour acheter une caméra afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de la clientèle. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité et avoir plus tard une famille.
texts.en: Kossivi is a 28 year old man. He is single and has no children. Kossivi has worked as a photographer since 2003. He works with his customers at their own locations. His problem is that he does not have a fixed location from which to operate. He is seeking this loan in order to buy a camera to be able to better meet his customers' needs. He wishes to reinvest in the business, and in due course to have a family.

loans.use: purchase a camera

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cosmetics, drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Kuña Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Kuña Mbarete es de la ciudad de Itá, está integrado por 12 mujeres de la ciudad de Itá. Actualmente el grupo está en el tercer ciclo y la meta de todas ellas es trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo ayudar a sus familias y darles un futuro sin privaciones como las que ellas tuvieron que pasar. 
Mirian es la presidente del grupo y comenta que se dedica a la peluquería desde hace un tiempo. Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela gracias a que siempre hace muy buenos trabajos y por ello siempre vuelven sus clientes. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de peines, spray, shampoo, enjuagues, tintes y demás insumos que utiliza en su negocio, ya que ellos son los que más usa día a día.
texts.en:
The Kuña Mbarete communal bank is in the city of Itá.  It is comprised of 12 women from the city of Itá.  The group is currently in its third cycle.  They all have the goal of working together and through this work helping their families.  Their goal is to give their families a future without the hardships that they had to experience.

Mrian is the president of the group.  She says that she has been a hairdresser for some time.  She has very good clientele, thanks to the fact that she always does a very good job.  That is why her customers always return.

She is requesting the loan to buy combs, spray, shampoo, rinses, dyes, and other supplies that she uses in her business.  Those are the ones that she uses the most day to day.

loans.use: to buy combs, spray, shampoo, rinses, dyes, and other supplies

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japheth, 57 years of age, has been in farming for over 30 years. His farm produces maize, beans and milk, all of which he sells to the local market to meet his family's daily needs. Poor prices for farm produce as well as disease are his main business challenges.

Now requesting his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 30,000 KES to buy birds for a new venture into poultry farming, Japheth is focusing on gradually improving his farming business and hopes to acquire more land in the future for more expansive and better farming. He aspires to cultivate more than seven acres each year in the future and increase the size of his poultry venture.

loans.use: to buy birds for his poultry business.

loans.name: Rim

texts.en:
Rim, forty-nine, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Chhanng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in an agricultural business for over twenty years, has an extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and other agricultural crops. Approximately, she earns USD 3 per day. All of her children are employed. They earn about USD 10 per day.  

In order to improve her farming work, Rim is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland. This purchase will help her reduce the tilling and crop-delivery expenses. In the future, she would like to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland.

loans.name: Hyline

texts.en:
Hyline is a mother of two children, aged eight and seven, and has been in active farming for four years. She is twenty-nine years old and produces milk and maize, which she sells to the local market to meet her family's basic needs.

Hyline has made a second loan request worth 31,200 KES with Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the income will go into improving her family living standards as well as repaying the loan, in order to acquire better assets in future.

Hyline is worried about the high cost of feeds and about animal disease management.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
Bimala is thirty-one years old. She is married and has two children aged twelve and nine. In 2005, she established her poultry business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy small chickens for her business. 

In the future, Bimala plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Musu.  She is married and has 5 children. In 1985, Musu established her cookery business. As a cleaner in a government hospital,  she realized that members of the staff always go out of the office during lunch hour. With a low income, she took advantage and decided to establish her cookery business.  

Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, Musu earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.  Musu requires this loan in order to buy rice and cooking oil in large quantity at reduced prices. In the future, Musu plans to open a restaurant and educated her children.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
This is Musu, 45. She is married with three children aged 12, 16 and 21, all in school. She has two additional dependents that live with her for schooling.  In 1987, Musu established her pans and plastic dishes business. She began her business to become independent and it is her only source of income. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 900,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from this business.

Musu would like a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more pans and plastic dishes. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Musu plans to seek more funds and expand her business, to own a house and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy pans and plastic dishes.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en: Hamisi is a single man who operates a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business for three years now. He aims to purchase a passenger vehicle in the future. The high price of fuel is a major challenge for him. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water and his greatest monthly expense is food. Hamisi plans to use his loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to purchase another motorcycle. He therefore joined Yehu to get cheap funds to meet his objectives.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Aubrey

texts.en:
Aubrey is from Migcanaway, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is thirty-three years old. Aubrey is single and has a child.

Aubrey runs a general store where she sells a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. She's been in business for six years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Aubrey is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, Aubrey joined GDMPC. She intend to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is from Migpange, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is sixty-six years old, a widow, and has four children. To make a living, Juanita cooks and sells food for daily meals. Juanita has been in her business for fourteen years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Juanita joined GDMPC. Juanita is requesting a loan of 6,800 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is twenty-two years old. She is married and has one child, aged five. In 2005, she established her grocery business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy grocery goods for her business.  

In the future, Rita plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Abu Bakarr. He is married and has three children aged eighteen, fifteen and twelve years.

In 2007, Abu Bakarr established his rice and timber business because he needed a reliable source of income to provide for his family. Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about 700,000 SLL every month.

Abu Bakarr is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 SLL from ARD in order to buy more timber and rice to sell. His ambition is to build a house and give his children a quality education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more timber and rice to sell.

loans.name: Rekha

texts.en:
Rekha is thirty-two years old. She is married and has two children aged twelve and five. In 2004, she established her grocery business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy grocery goods for her business.  

In the future, Rekha plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Morm

texts.en:
Morm, sixty, is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. For four years, she has been running the business of buying rice to resell for a profitable price, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her children are employed in a gas station and a garment factory. They earn about USD 6 per day. 

Morm is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom. By doing so, she will be able to provide hygienic living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to get another loan from Kredit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is twenty-six years old and lives in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has two children. Christine is a farmer. She plants and harvests vegetables to earn a living. She sells vegetables like eggplants, okra and pumpkins. She has been working for eight years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 from this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 4,500 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers. Christine been member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Christine hopes to gain more income and purchase additional land for vegetable production.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Battsengel

texts.en:
Battsengel is a thirty-seven-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in a 'ger' in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife is employed and the children go to Kindergarden. He has been running a taxi service business since 2008 with his own van. The business has been successful because there is a big demand for taxi services in the city. 

However, in order to continue the business successfully, the van's motor needs to be replaced. He is planning to replace to motor with some support. Battsengel is a responsible man who says that "I would like to continue the business so I can feed my family and improve their livelihood. I have a further plan to replace my van with a bigger van with more seats".  The total amount he is requesting is 600,000 MNT to replace the motor of his van.

loans.use: To replace the motor of his van.

loans.name: Adele

texts.en:
Adele is 28 years old and married to a businessman. They have three children aged between five months and six years, two of whom are in school.

For the past two years Adele has owned a shop where she sells different items such as rice, sugar and salt, to mention a few. She is requesting a 500000 RWF from UOB to buy more rice, sugar, potatoes, cooking oil and salt to sell.

Adele plans to use her profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, potatoes, cooking oil and salt to sell.

loans.name: Chernoh

texts.en:
This is 55-year-old Chernor.  He is married and has no children.   In 2002, Chernor established his clothing and baby dress business. He began his business with the hope of establishing a clothing factory.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business as profit. 

Chernor would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. He requires this loan in order to buy more clothing and baby dress to meet the demand of parents coming to buy for their children. In the future, Chernor plans to expand his business into different areas.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Mariama.  She is married and has 4 children aged 20,17,15 and 10 years. She has 2 additional dependents living with her.   

In 1982, Mariama established her business selling textiles, clothing, suitcases, etc.  She is not educated. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Mariama would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. She requires this loan in order to buy more textiles and clothing, as it is in high demand in her market area.  In the future, Mariama plans to build her own house and own her own shop.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy textiles and clothing to sell

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 6 and 3 years.

In 2005, Fatmata established her salon and cosmetics business. It was her husband that encouraged her to engage in business for herself.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. 

Fatmata would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. She requires this loan in order to buy more quantities of hair products. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her salon into a cosmetology school to train young girls. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy hair products

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Isata.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 18, 15 and 6 years. 

In 2004, Isata established her rice, salt, oil and Maggi (soy sauce) and bags business. She began her business to help her husband to settle some family problems. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

Isata would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.   She requires this loan in order to purchase bags of rice of different varieties. In the future, Isata plans to expand another outlet to be managed by her sales assistant.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy rice to resell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 49 years old. She is married and has 3 children, aged 30, 25 and 17 years. 

In 1997, Rebecca established her dry fish business. She began her business as a young girl who was desirous to be self-supporting, taking into consideration she came from a poor family background.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business as profit. 

Rebecca would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  She requires this loan in order to purchase more baskets of fish. In the future, Rebecca plans to develop faster for a better standard of living and a higher educational level for her children and to erect a house.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy fish to resell

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Abu Bakarr.  He is married and has 3 children, aged 19, 12 and 3 years. He has 2 additional dependents living with him to assist him with his business.  

In 2007, Abu Bakarr established his business selling provisions and assorted items such as toothpaste, soap, etc. He began his business because there was no job after college.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. 

Abu Bakarr would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  He requires this loan in order to buy more provisions, toothpaste, and soap from manufacturer’s agents at a reduced cost and sell wholesale in his community to petty traders.  In the future, Abu Bakarr plans to expand his business and educate his children.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy provisions, toothpaste and soap

loans.name: Ambika

texts.en:
Ambika is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has two children aged eighteen and fourteen. In 2000, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid nine loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy seeds and fertilizer. 

In the future, Ambika plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is married with five children. He is forty-seven years old, and resides in Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Nestor raises bananas for sale to earn a living and has been thirty-one years in this business. Each month, he earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of business. 

He requested a loan of PHP 4,832 to purchase fertilizers and young seedlings to plant. In 2010, Nestor joined GDMPC. In the future, Nestor wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and young seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Noun, fifty-seven, is married, resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Four of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about USD 12 per day. 

Noun is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase construction materials to build a kitchen. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child get a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 36-year-old resident of Bagumbang, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She supports her 4 children's needs from the little amount of PHP 3,000 she gains monthly from her piggery business, which she has run for 13 years as an aid to the income gained from her husband.  In 2008, she became a member of GDMPC.  

Marina applied for a loan at GDMPC micro finance for PHP 3,300 to buy feeding supplies and young piglets to raise. Marina aims to make expansions to her business one day.

loans.use: buy pig feed and piglets

loans.name: Jesel

texts.en:
Jesel is married and has 3 children. She is 40 years old and lives in Bagumbang, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Jesel owns and operates a business selling a variety of products to earn a living. She has been in this business 13 years ago and earns PHP 3,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 4,800 to obtain more products such as vegetables, eggs, etc.  Jesel has been a member of Kiva's partner GDMPC since 2008.  In the future, Jesel aims to sustain her family's daily financial needs and to improve her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Tara

texts.en:
Tara is thirty-five years old. She is married and has two children aged twenty-two and sixteen. In 2005, she established her poultry business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy small chickens.  

In the future, Tara plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chickens.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: La Sra Silvia quien por el momento se dedica a las labores domesticas y a el cuidado de sus pequeños que se encuentran en edad escolar Junto con su esposo el Sr. Lucas Quien labora en una empresa desde hace tres años los dos son personas muy trabajadoras y amables su mayor anhelo es darle lo mejor a sus hijos es por eso que acuden con nosotros para tramitar el apoyo para poder darleuna vista bella a su cuarto y asi mismo impermeabilizar.
texts.en:
Silvia, who currently works as a housewife and cares for her small children, who are of school age. Silvia and her husband, Lucas, who has been working in business for three years, are two hard working and kind people, whose main desire is to provide the best for their children. 

This is why they have joined us, to receive the support to be able to provide an attractive environment in their room and also to waterproof it.

loans.use: to waterproof and paint her room.

loans.name: Ram Keshari

texts.en:
Ram Keshari is twenty-five years old. She is married and has one child, aged five. In 2005, she established her furniture-making business. Working seven days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buys wood and timbers. 

In the future, Ram Keshari plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way. Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture. With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets. With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of their lumber purchases or hire additional labor. This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Ishori

texts.en:
Ishori, sixty years old, is married and has two children aged 35 and 34 years. In 1995 she started farming vegetables. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she helps support her family.

Ishori has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW. With this 30000 NPR loan she will buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm. With her farm profits Ishori plans to raise her family’s standard of living. She thanks you for your support.

Note: Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal) and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.

With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seed and fertilizer fro her farm.

loans.name: La Poderosa Group

texts.es:
Las poderosas se denomina el Excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que una de las miembros contactó con la asesora para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité y juntó a 18 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 3° ciclo, dentro de un ambiente de respeto y ayuda mutua. 
Emigdia es la presidenta del grupo, y ella misma se define como una persona muy trabajadora y que tiene muchas ansias de ser una gran microempresaria y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia con su trabajo. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, y comenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que siempre tiene gran variedad de prendas que ofrecer a sus clientes. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de variedad de prendas, con lo cual podrá tener mayor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes y tener un mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
Las Poderosas is the name of an excellent group of women set up in the city of Itá, thanks to one of the members who contacted the adviser to find out about how the communal bank works and joined together with 18 women who are working very comfortably and are now in their 3rd loan cycle, in an environment of respect and mutual assistance.

Emigdia is the group president, she describes herself as a hard working person and is eager to be a great small businesswoman and to be able help her family through her work. She sells clothes and comments that she has a very good customer base because she always has a wide variety of garments to offer her clients.

She is requesting the loan to buy various garments, so she can have a greater variety to offer her clients and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy garments to sell.

loans.name: 7 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “7 DE MAYO” iniciará su tercer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Susana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de verduras, producción de chamarras, venta de abarrotes, venta de mantas, producción de puertas, venta de ropa, venta de carne y verduras, venta de comida.

La señora Susana, indica que hace tres años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de unas amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace años, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su capital, (compra de abarrotes), mismo que comprará de la ferias de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “7 de Mayo” Communal Bank is beginning its 3rd loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani cluster. The bank has 8 members and is directed by a board headed by Susana. The businesses pursued by the communal association's members are varied, but include: selling green vegetables,  groceries, scarves, clothing, meat and greens, and meals, and making jackets and doors.

Susana tells us that some 3 years ago her communal association joined Pro Mujer, on the invitation of friends. At present, she owns a neighborhood store that she has operated for years. She learned this activity from her father.
 
The loan Susana is taking out will augment her capital, and be used to buy groceries, which she will obtain from markets in the city of El Alto. Later, she will re-sell the items in her stall. Her business will provide assistance for her family. Susana lives with a partner and has 4 children. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she liked the health care.

loans.use: purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ykua Maria Group

texts.es:
El grupo se encuentra integrado por 19 mujeres muy trabajadoras, las mismas se encuentran en el 7mo. Ciclo con una buena calificación, aunque han tenido algunos inconvenientes ellas lo han sabido sobrellevar. Son personas con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. 
Adelaida es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella comenta que se dedica a la lavandería. Ella trabaja todos los días lavando las prendas que recibe como pedidos a ser lavadas. Gracias a su arduo esfuerzo y sacrificio ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de jabones, enjuagues para ropas, suavizantes, y demás insumos que necesite para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The group is made up of 19 very hard working women, who have reached their 7th cycle with a good rating. Although they have had some difficulties, they have managed to survive. 

They are all people with a desire to succeed and to support their families.

Adelaida is a very hard working and enterprising person, she comments that she works at a launderette.She works everyday washing the garments she receives with orders to be washed. Thanks to her strong effort and sacrifice she has been able to support her family.

She requests the loan to buy soaps and rinses for clothes, softeners and other supplies that she needs to enable her to continue working.

loans.use: to buy soaps and rinses for clothes, softeners and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy baby clothing and other baby items.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny, 18 years old, is a single entrepreneur from Canicapan in Clarin. For almost the past three years she has been making money working on her family’s coconut plantation. She usually earns 5,000 PHP monthly.

Jenny joined GDMPC just this year. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to pay labor costs for her coconut harvest. Before long she hopes to expand her family's coconut business.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for her coconut harvest.

loans.name: Las Flores De El Llano Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las flores de el  llano está  conformado por  cinco mujeres trabajadoras y humildes con deseos de  hacer crecer su negocio.
Las integrantes de este grupo son originarias de  un pequeño pueblo llamado llano grande donde la mayoría de las personas son gente humilde y buena  con deseos de crecer.
En llano grande la banda puedes ver como  los niños juegan en las calles y se van al campo   a hacer volar sus papalotes.
Una de las tradiciones de llano grande es la fiesta de todo santo  donde se baila el tradicional baile de la tortuga, ese baile lo bailan en las calles van los hombres vestidos de mujeres  y una tortuga quien baila junto con ellos.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la  señora Olivia de cuarenta y ocho años de edad , se dedica a la venta de pollos desde hace  cuatro años.
Doña Olivia mejor conocida como doña Mari  nos cuenta que lo que más le gusta de su negocio es  pelar sus pollos con amor y atender bien a sus clientes.
Doña Mari  nos dice que está muy contenta porque su negocio le deja buenas ganancias  ya si puede mejorar su calidad de vida.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Nereo José de cuarenta  y nueve años de edad con quien tiene cinco hijos: Juan Jose, Adelina, Ruben y Antonio.
Doña Mari pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas pollos para la  venta destazados y  vivos.
Doña Mari nos dice que está muy contenta por el apoyo que le ha dado  fundación  y por la confianza  que le brindado para que su vida mejore y así pueda  seguir con su negocio.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Irma- se dedica a la venta de carne.
Micaelina - se dedica a la venta de carne.
Bertina – se dedica a la venta de mercería.
Maribel- se dedica a la venta de pollos.
 Le dan las gracias a fundación por ayudarlas a que  sus negocios mejoren.
texts.en:
The group named Las Flores de El Llano is made up of five hardworking and modest women who want to make their businesses grow.  The members of this group are from a small town named Llano Grande, where the majority are modest and good people who want to grow.

In Llano Grande La Banda you can see the children play in the streets and go to the field to fly their kites.  One of the traditions in Llano Grande is the All Saints festival at which the traditional dance of the tortoise is danced in the streets.  The men dress as women and as a tortoise who dances with them.

One of the members of this group is Olivia, 48.  She has worked selling chicken for four years.  Olivia, better known as Mari, tells us that what she likes most about her business is lovingly plucking her chickens and serving her customers well.  She is very happy because her business gives her good profits, and so she is able to improve her quality of life.  She is happily married to Nereo José, 49, with whom she has five children, Juan, José, Adelina, Rubén, and Antonio.

Mari requested the loan to buy more chickens to sell cut into pieces and alive.

Mari tells us she is very happy about the support from the foundation and the confidence it has given her to improve her life and continue with her business.

The other members of the group are Irma, who sells meat; Micaelina, who sells meat; Bertina, who sells notions; and Maribel, who sells chickens.  They thank the foundation for helping them improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Madres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité "Madres Trabajadoras" tiene 1 año de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya, la mayoría de sus integrantes ya viene realizando una actividad productiva. Ellas son mujeres con mucho entusiasmo y con ganas de salir adelante. 
La Sra. Hilaria es una persona muy sacrificada y trabajadora, ella se dedica al reciclaje de todo tipo de artículos, como ser cartón y plástico. Comenta que empieza desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana juntando los plásticos y cartones. Este es un trabajo muy digno para ella, ya que le permite dar con ello a su familia lo que necesitan, además de ser un trabajo honesto. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de plásticos y cartón, ya que al revenderlos podrá tener mayor ganancia. Hilaria y sus compañeras agradecen a la fundación y a Kiva por la ayuda que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Madres Trabajadores" was established 1 year ago and works with Fundación Paraguaya, the majority of its members are already succeeding in working productively. They are women with lots of enthusiasm and desire to succeed. 

Hilaria is a very self-sacrificing and hard working person, her job is to recycle all kinds of items like cardboard and plastic. She says that she starts work in the early hours of the morning collecting plastics and cardboard. This is a very worthy job for her, as it allows her to provide for her family as well as being honest work.

She is requesting this loan to buy plastics and cardboard to resell them at a profit. Hilaria and her partners are grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for the help that they receive.

loans.use: to buy plastic and cardboard.

loans.name: Ababacar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ababacar  âgé de 36 ans est commerçant depuis 10 ans. Il gère une boutique d’alimentation générale. Il est marié et père de 5 enfants dont l’ainé a 12 ans et le cadet, 2 ans. Il sollicite un crédit de 500000F CFA pour acheter  de l’huile, du riz, mais aussi de l’aliment bétail (ripasse). Ababacar démarre sa journée à 7h du matin pour la terminer à 23h du soir.
Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille.
Le prêt va lui permettre d’augmenter son stock de marchandises et d’attirer la clientèle. Il veut agrandir son activé et nourri le projet d’ouvrir un magasin.
texts.en:
Mr. Ababacar, aged 36, has been a merchant for ten years. He runs a shop selling groceries. He is married and a father of five children, of whom the oldest is 12 years old, and the youngest is 2. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs CFA to buy oil and rice and also some animal feed (ripasse). 

Ababacar starts his day at 7:00 in the morning and finishes at 11:00 at night. He takes care of his family's day-to-day expenses.  

The loan will enable him to increase his stock of merchandise and to attract customers. He wants to expand his business and to nurture plans to open a store.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for his store (oil, rice) and animal feed.

loans.name: Naranjales Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NARANJALES” iniciará su segundo ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Ximena. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de peluches, venta de fruta, tienda de lácteos, venta de salchipapas, tienda de barrio

La señora Ximena, indica que hace ocho meses que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras que viene trabajando hace años, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su capital, (compra de verduras), mismo que comprará de la ferias de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "NARANJALES" will begin their second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional office. The group has 8 members and is run by a board of directors led by Ximena. The businesses that the members of the communal bank put forward are varied and include: food sales, toy sales, fruit sales, dairy sales, sales of "salchipapas" - fried potatoes with hot dog, and a corner shop.

Ximena has been a member of the communal bank with Pro Mujer for 8 months, having joined by invitation from a friend. Currently, she has a vegetable sales business, which she has been working in for years having learnt the trade from her mother.

The loan that she will now take out is to raise her capital (to buy vegetables), which she will buy at the markets in the city of El Alto and later sell at her regular post. This business helps her to support her family as she lives with her partner and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that it's the health.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Vugukora B / Rbv Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco fait partie du groupe Vugukora B. Il a 30 ans, il est marie avec 4 enfants de 3 ans à 11 ans, dont 3 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jean Bosco est agriculteur maïs. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 60 kgs de haricots pour la semence et payer la main d’œuvre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’acheter d’autres champs et augmenter les capacités des semences à utiliser. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Bosco voudrait être le premier agriculteur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco is part of the Vugukora B group. He is 30 years old and is married with four children aged between three and 11 years old (three of his children go to school). He has six years of primary education.
Jean Bosco is a corn farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB, and he plans to use the loan to purchase 60 kilos of beans for sowing and to cover his labor costs.
To ensure that his business grows Jean Bosco plans to buy more fields and increase the capacity of the seeds he will sow. Over the coming years he would like to become the leading farmer in his region. He plans to use his profits to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase 60 kilos of beans for sowing and to cover his labor costs.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice lives in the Likoni area of Kenya.  She is a single mother of one child and runs a used clothing business.  It has been in operation for one-and-a-half years.  

Eunice learned about Milango from her friends and she is applying for a loan of 40,000 KES in order to purchase additional items of clothing to stock and sell.  Her only challenge is that some clients do not pay on time.  Eunice believes she can grow her business, which will enable her to achieve her personal goal to purchase a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of clothing to stock and sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a kerosene dealer living in Likoni, Kenya.  He has run this business for eight years.  He started this business with capital of about $170.  Simon is also married and has four children.

He is applying for a loan of 40,000 KES in order to purchase additional kerosene to stock and sell.  His main challenge is the high cost of fuel.  He says that the extra income generated by this loan will help him address both emergencies when they arise and the common problem of customers not paying on time.

His desire is also to be able to export kerosene across the region.

loans.use: to purchase additional kerosene to stock and sell.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan lives in Changamwe, Kenya. He is a retail shop owner of a business that has been in operation for four years. He is the father of two children. Jonathan would like to diversify to other forms of business to increase his income. He is therefore applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase charcoal for sale. Charcoal is always in demand during the rainy seasons. He believes the income from this venture will help him educate his children. His ambition is to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou plants, harvests, and sells bananas for a living. She's a 35-year-old married mother of 2 children. They live in Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Marilou has run this business for 10 years and she gets 6,100 PHP a month. In 2010, Marilou became a member of GDMPC. Now she is asking for a loan amounting to 11,118 PHP. This will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She dreams of having a huge mansion someday and hopes for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Miel Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MIEL” iniciará su cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Faviana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: artesanía, venta de verduras, venta de conservas, trabajo en joyas, comerciante de zapatos, venta de perfumes, confección venta de mantas.

La señora Faviana, indica que hace años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus compañeros. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de mantas que viene trabajando hace años, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de lana, que le ayudará a aumentar su mercadería, mismo que adquiere de las comerciales de la ciudad de El Alto y posterior a su elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias de la misma ciudad. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Rosmini por motivos culturales oviamos su participación.
texts.en:
The “MIEL” ["Honey"] communal bank will be starting its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II service center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors, headed by Faviana. The businesses operated by the members of this communal bank are diverse, and they include handicrafts, vegetable sales, sales of preserved foods, jewelry work, shoe sales, perfume sales, and blanket making and selling. 

Faviana reports that she has been a member of a communal bank with Pro Mujer for years, after entering on the invitation of her colleagues. Currently, she has a business making and selling blankets. She has been working in this area for years, and she learned the profession from her mother. 
 
The loan she will now be taking out is to buy wool, which will help her increase her stock of merchandise. She buys it from stores in the city of El Alto, and after she makes her blankets, she sells them at the markets in the same city. This business helps her support her family; she is married and has four children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training in the areas of health and credit. 

[One of the members,] Rosmini, is not shown in the photograph; she preferred not to participate for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Vimely

texts.en: Vimely, 38 years old, lives in Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental with her 4 kids. She opened a grocery store 2 years ago and this serves as their main source of income. She typically earns 7,350 PHP every month. In 2008, she became a member of GDMPC. Now she needs to increase her stock, so she decided to ask for a loan of 20,828 PHP from GDMPC.  With that, she hopes she will develop her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock

loans.name: El Salto De Pailahueque Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “El Salto de Pailahueque” está conformado por 18 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran artesanía, costuras, pintura y preparación de comida, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Irma quien en la foto se encuentra en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda. Viste una polera manga corta color beige. Su cabello es corto y de color cobrizo.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la repostería, específicamente a la producción de tortas y pasteles de diferentes sabores y tamaños. Se desempeña en este rubro desde hace 12 años, comenta que realizó un curso en un grupo del cual formaba parte, en ese tiempo.
Comenta que habilitó un pequeño local en su casa para preparar sus productos, sin embargo aún no lo puede formalizar para vender directamente a sus clientes, debido a que aún le falta por obtener el permiso de salubridad, el cual recibirá éste año. Por ahora solo vende a pedido y puerta a puerta.
Sus insumos los compra en supermercados mayoristas cada tres meses.
Con el crédito comprará ingredientes para preparar sus productos de repostería.
Una de sus metas es formalizar su local y negocio, para vender directamente a sus clientes.
Irma vive junto a su esposo, quien es jubilado y también junto a su hijo de 20 años de edad, quien estudia la carrera de psicología.
Uno de sus sueños, en el ámbito personal es viajar o tomarse algunos días de descanso en alguna terma (baños de aguas minerales calientes). 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda en participar con las demás emprendedoras, ya que el grupo es bueno, unido y comprometido. Respecto a las capacitaciones, comenta que la han orientado a mejorar el negocio a través de estrategias de contabilidad y organización.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank, called "El Salto de Pailahueque", is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who make a living in different fields among which crafting, dressmaking, painting, and food preparation, among others, can be found.  They are all from the city of Temuco.

In the photo, Irma can be found in the first row, second spot from the right, wearing a beige short-sleeved shirt.  Her hair is short and copper-colored.  She makes a living in the confectionery field, specifically in the production of cakes and pastries of different flavors and sizes.  She has worked in this field for 12 years, and says she took a course in a group which included her at that time.  She says that she has equipped a small place in her house so that she can prepare her products; nevertheless, she still cannot use it to sell directly to her clients because she still needs to obtain the health permit, which she will receive this year.  For now she only sells by asking door to door.  She buys her ingredients in wholesale supermarkets every three months.  With the loan she will buy ingredients to prepare her confectionery products.  One of her goals is to formalize her location and business in order to sell directly to her clients.

Irma lives with her husband who is retired, and also with her 20 year old son who studies psychology.  One of her dreams in her personal life is to travel or spend a few days of relaxation in some thermal baths (baths of hot mineral water).  She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza since it will allow her to invest in her business.  Furthermore, she feels very comfortable participating with the other entrepreneurs since it is a good, united, and committed group.  With regard to the training, she says it has bettered her business through accounting strategies and organization.  

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  In its surrounding areas there are a series of lake resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and very colorful native flora and fauna concentrated in nearby nature parks.  It's worth pointing out that 50% of the Mapuches, an indigenous people that live in our country, live in this region.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare her confectionery products.

loans.name: Nozim

texts.ru: Нозим проживает в районе Кубодиен. Ему 37 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Нозим занимается скотоводством. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Nozim lives in the Qubadiyon district.  He is 37 years old, married and has two children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Nozim is involved in animal husbandry.  He has been in this business for two years.  He is requesting this loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru: Толиб проживает в районе Кубодиен. Ему 70 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Толиб занимается скотоводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Tolib lives in the Qubadiyon district.  He is 70 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Tolib is involved in animal husbandry.  He breeds cattle at home.  He is requesting this loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Gulai

texts.ru:
Гулай 57 лет. В качестве основного источника  дохода для своей семьи, Гулай занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 2000 году. Благодаря упорному труду Гулай,  ее бизнес, начатый с суммы 2,000 сом  позволяет ей иметь  прибыль в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS) с месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. На сегодняшний день, в ее хозяйстве имеется 4 дойные коровы, 10 овец, также Гулай возделывает 1,20 га земли, где выращивает хлопок.   
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулай обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота и минерального удобрения.  Доходы от кредита Гулай планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulai is 57 years old.  To provide a primary source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started this business in 2009.  Thanks to Gulai's hard work, her business, started with a sum of 2,000 som, now allows her to have a profit of 5,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products.  Today, her business contains four dairy cows and ten sheep.  Gulai also works on 1.20 hectares of land where she grows cotton.  In order to further develop her business, Gulai requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock and mineral fertilizers.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fertilizers

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario La Amistad  está conformado por tres emprendedoras que son mujeres muy luchadora que se ha unido para formar este grupo en el cual cada una de ellas tiene su propio negocios, se brindan consejos para sus negocios que tienen. Maria Esperanza es parte de este grupo y su negocio al que se dedica es a la venta de mercadería en general su negocio lo tiene ubicado en  uno de los mercados de la localidad donde habita, está solicitando financiamiento para comprar ropa, camisas, blúmer, pantalones, faldas, sandalias entre otros productos.
texts.en:
The “La Amistad” (Friendship) solidarity group is made up of three entrepreneurs that are very tenacious women who have joined together to form this group in which each of them has her own business and advise each other on their businesses.

María Esperanza is part of this group and the business she has is selling general merchandise.  Her business is located in one of the markets in the location where she lives.  She’s asking for financing to buy clothes, shirts, bloomers, pants, skirts and sandals, among other products.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Nayran Sarantañani Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NAYRAN SARANTAÑANI II” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Martha. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de carne de cerdo, macramé en mantas, venta de ganado vacuno, tejido de chompas a máquina, tejido de polainas, venta de leche, librería.
